Given that the rightmost cube has a circle on its right side, this implies that the circle is not on the front or top face of that cube. Therefore, the circle must be on the right face, and the front and top faces must be the remaining patterns: star, triangle, heart, square, and cross.

The rightmost cube has a triangle on its front face, so the leftmost cube cannot have a triangle on its right face. Similarly, the rightmost cube has a cross on its top face, so the leftmost cube cannot have a cross on its right face.

This leaves only the square as a possible pattern for the right face of the leftmost cube.

Therefore, the left face of the leftmost cube must be the remaining pattern, which is the cross.
